description: From Middle English childhode, childhod, from Old English ċildhād (“childhood”), equivalent to child +‎ -hood. Compare dialectal Dutch kindheid (“childishness”), German Low German Kinnerheid (“childhood”), and German Kindheit (“childhood”).

entries.meaning: (chiefly uncountable) The state of being a child.
The time during which one is a child, from between infancy and puberty.
(by extension) The early stages of development of something.
